intro: Galium erythrorrhizon, commonly known as redroot sandwort, is a low-growing perennial herb belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, reddish stems that often have a hairy texture. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a waxy coating. Galium erythrorrhizon is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
